titleInfo.title: R U N A W A Y.

mods.abstract: R U N A W A Y . WAS committed to the jail of this parish, on this 18th inst., a Negro Man, calling himself FORTUNE, and who says that he belongs to Dr. Gauge, residing on Black River. Said negro is about 30 years old ; of very black complexion, and about 5 feet 2 or 3 inches in height. The owner is requested to come forward, pay charges, and take him out of jail. LOUIS FABRE, Jailor. P't Coupee, Sept. 24, 1859.

detail.title: Pointe Coupee Democrat. : (False River [i.e. New Roads], Parish of Pointe Coupee [La.]) 1858-1890

recordInfo.recordOrigin: Transformed into MODS from extended Dublin Core by the LDL Development Team at Louisiana State University.
